title: The Story Behind Prague's Astronomical Clock
text:

If you’re visiting Prague for the first-time, you can't afford to miss one of the city’s most famous attractions: its astronomical clock tower, which has rung out the time, every single hour, for more than 600 years. Even now, the hourly performance of the clock, where the Apostles and other characters come out in procession, amazes visitors from all over the world. But how was the clock created, and how does it stand among the city’s sources of pride? 
Old Town Square’s Highlight 
Built sometime between 1410 and 1490, the famous astronomical clock is remarkable not only for its sheer longevity (it’s one of the three oldest astronomical clocks in the world, but the only one that is still functioning well) but also for its showmanship. Designed to tell time but also entertain and remind people of certain truths of life, every hour the clock comes to life as the twelve apostles file out of two open doors. Other minor characters also serve as asides to the hourly show: a skeleton rings a bell, while a Turk shakes his head. Meanwhile, the character understood to represent vanity looks in the mirror - a poignant footnote to the chimera nature of beauty and the swiftness of time’s passage. The hourly show is capped off by the crowing of a golden rooster and the ringing of the bell at the tower’s top. 
More than Just a Clock 
The astronomical clock is not only designed to tell time, but also to the months and the position of important heavenly bodies. For the modern tourist, these things may no longer be considered important, but during Medieval times, when even the question of whether the Earth moved around the sun or otherwise was still in question, the clock was an important human achievement. 
Over the centuries, the clock tower has come to embody many layers of cultural meaning and significance for its citizens and, while the circumstances of the clock’s creation is documented in fact, it is nevertheless shrouded in myth - some sinister, some intriguing. In any case, the astronomical clock is a true wonder of human craftsmanship and ingenuity, and one that has been delighting visitors for many years.
